p: Severe infection and complications occur more frequently in males and those with underlying medical conditions (called co-morbidities), including hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and immunocompromised states. Findings associated with poor outcomes include an increase in white blood cell counts with lymphopenia, a prolonged prothrombin time (indicating coagulopathy), and elevated levels of liver enzymes, lactate dehydrogenase, D-dimer, interleukin-6, C-reactive protein, and procalcitonin ( Gandhi etÂ al., 2020).
